Package components

Class MainOffice

java.lang.Object
components.MainOffice
public class MainOffice
extends java.lang.Object
Manages the entire system, operates a clock, branches and vehicles, creates packages and transfers them to the appropriate branches.
Version:
1.0, 9/4/2021
Author:
Itzik Rahamim - 312202351, Gil Ben Hamo - 315744557

    Change the packages list
    void tick()
    Activate one beat in the clock, in every beat the following actions are performed: Printing the time and add 1 to the clock. All branches, sorting center and vehicles perform one work unit. Every 5 beats a random new package is created. At the end of the run, prints a message and all history for the created packages.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainOffice

      public MainOffice​(int branches, int trucksForBranch)
      Constructs and initializes a MainOffice by values
      Example: MainOffice(6,3)
      Parameters:
      branches - A list of all the branches in the system.
      trucksForBranch - - A list of all the trucks in the system.

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play​(int playTime)
      Receives a number of beats that the system will perform, and executes the tick() function several times.
      Parameters:
      playTime - Number of beats.

    • printReport

      public void printReport()
      Prints a follow-up report for all packages in the system.

    • clockString

      public java.lang.String clockString()
      Get a string of the clock in this current moment.
      Returns:
      The value of the clock in MM: SS format.

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Activate one beat in the clock, in every beat the following actions are performed:
      • Printing the time and add 1 to the clock.
      • All branches, sorting center and vehicles perform one work unit.
      • Every 5 beats a random new package is created.
      • At the end of the run, prints a message and all history for the created packages.

    • addPackage

      public void addPackage()
      A package lottery (random type and values)
      Creates it and associates it with the appropriate branch.

    • getClock

      Get the current time
      Returns:
